comment.author: 33902818@N08
comment._content: Rural letter carriers are still to this day responsible for supplying their own transportation.

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: Very spiffy automobile. Lots of brass!

comment.author: 20288302@N08
comment._content: That's my grandfather - Roy Byron Aler (1887-1975) who was the carrier for RFD 1 out of Harbor Springs, MI for about 45 years starting in 1912. The date on the license plate is 1914. I have some similar photos and related postings at: picasaweb.google.com/donorgan/ReSmithsonian#

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Hi Don!
It's great to hear from you, and thanks for the link! I will certainly forward this onto my colleagues at the National Postal Museum. 

Sincerely, 

Susannah 
Smithsonian Institution Archives
